definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

sentences.english: A hold created with a hamer and chisel by a moron uncapable of doing the climb as it is.
sentences.chinese: 用鎚子或鑿子鑿出來的把手點，是一種低能的行爲。

sentences.english: We're going to nail this cabinet together. Can you get me a hammer?
sentences.chinese: 我們要一起釘這個櫥櫃，你可以拿支鐵鎚給我嗎？

sentences.english: The expert eyes of others locate a metate (grinding slab) and hammer stones.
sentences.chinese: 其他內行人則發現一些磨板和鎚石。

sentences.english: You invoke the hammer to call down a radiant burst upon your foes.
sentences.chinese: 你呼喚這鎚對你的仇散降下一道輝耀爆。

sentences.english: Scissors and claw hammer that belongs to such leverage.
sentences.chinese: 剪刀及拔釘鎚即屬於此類槓桿。

definition: chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
small earthenware plate or basin/a monk's alms bowl/Sanskrit paatra
